radiographic_examinations.findings: Changes in the medial temporal lobe bilaterally that did not enhance, with no evidence of a mass, infarct, or ischemia.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the chest and abdomen
radiographic_examinations.findings: An anterior mediastinal mass (4.1 cm by 2.0 cm), calcified pleural plaques in the left middle chest, a tiny subpleural nodule in the posterior right middle lung, three hepatic cysts, calcified gallstones, and a round nodule of low density in the right adrenal gland.
Symmetric hyperintensity involving the medial temporal lobes, left basal forebrain, and bilateral insular regions, more on the left side.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreases in signal hyperintensity on FLAIR images and volume loss within the temporal lobes were noted on a subsequent MRI.
